verses.name: Psalms 109:1
verses.text: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

verses.name: Psalms 109:2
verses.text: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

verses.name: Psalms 109:3
verses.text: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

verses.name: Psalms 109:4
verses.text: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.

verses.name: Psalms 109:5
verses.text: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

verses.name: Psalms 109:6
verses.text: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

verses.name: Psalms 109:7
verses.text: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

verses.name: Psalms 109:8
verses.text: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.

verses.name: Psalms 109:9
verses.text: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

verses.name: Psalms 109:10
verses.text: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

verses.name: Psalms 109:11
verses.text: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

verses.name: Psalms 109:12
verses.text: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

verses.name: Psalms 109:13
verses.text: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

verses.name: Psalms 109:14
verses.text: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the Lord; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

verses.name: Psalms 109:15
verses.text: Let them be before the Lord continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

verses.name: Psalms 109:16
verses.text: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

verses.name: Psalms 109:17
verses.text: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

verses.name: Psalms 109:18
verses.text: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

verses.name: Psalms 109:19
verses.text: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

verses.name: Psalms 109:20
verses.text: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the Lord, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

verses.name: Psalms 109:21
verses.text: But do thou for me, O God the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.

verses.name: Psalms 109:22
verses.text: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

verses.name: Psalms 109:23
verses.text: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

verses.name: Psalms 109:24
verses.text: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

verses.name: Psalms 109:25
verses.text: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

verses.name: Psalms 109:26
verses.text: Help me, O Lord my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

verses.name: Psalms 109:27
verses.text: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, Lord, hast done it.

verses.name: Psalms 109:28
verses.text: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

verses.name: Psalms 109:29
verses.text: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

verses.name: Psalms 109:30
verses.text: I will greatly praise the Lord with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

verses.name: Psalms 109:31
verses.text: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.
